query: SELECT id, sectionId, questionNumber, questionText FROM complianceQuestions ORDER BY sectionId, CAST(SUBSTRING_INDEX(questionNumber, '.', 1) AS UNSIGNED), CAST(SUBSTRING_INDEX(questionNumber, '.', -1) AS UNSIGNED) LIMIT 50
command: mysql --batch --raw --column-names --default-character-set=utf8mb4 --host gateway02.us-east-1.prod.aws.tidbcloud.com --port 4000 --user aVmfAzGaFwUYThZ.5c3d77929c0b --database mF7Zux5nFuxUoJfuPYEPAJ --execute SELECT id, sectionId, questionNumber, questionText FROM complianceQuestions ORDER BY sectionId, CAST(SUBSTRING_INDEX(questionNumber, '.', 1) AS UNSIGNED), CAST(SUBSTRING_INDEX(questionNumber, '.', -1) AS UNSIGNED) LIMIT 50

rows.questionText: There is evidence that care and support files express individual’s views, choices, and preferences. - Includes pre admission, care plans, daily notes and life history

There is evidence that care, and support files have been written with involvement from the person and or their representative. (Where able, the documentation should be agreed and signed by the person).
The provider has a process in place to ensure that relevant documentation is available upon request in other formats i.e., easy read, large print, pictorial, other languages.
There is evidence that care, and support files are available and accessible to the person and their representatives in an appropriate format.
There is evidence that care, and support files demonstrate privacy, dignity, and independence. In line with their personal choices, prefences and wishes (not just in relation to personal care)
People who use the service felt treated with dignity and respect
People were encouraged to maintain their independence and their choices and preferences are upheld
Staff can explain how people’s dignity and privacy are respected
Observations confirmed people are given information in an appropriate way to make decisions i.e., Clothing, meals, and activities
People confirmed that they feel supported by staff to make informed decisions
People confirmed that they are supported to maintain relationships, access a variety of activities and the community
Staff are observed to have positive and meaningful interactions with people who use the service
There is evidence of appropriately signed consent for all relevant decisions where the person is deemed to have capacity. For example.

There is evidence of appropriately signed consent by the relevant LPA (Lasting Power of Attorney) where the person is deemed not to have capacity for a specific decision and there is a copy of the LPA on file.

There is evidence of appropriate mental capacity assessments and best interest decisions where the person is deemed to not have capacity for a specific decision.  These decisions have been made in collabouration with other representatives and/or other relevant parties. For example, -
There is evidence that the service has DOLs in place as required which demonstrates that least restrictive measures have been considered and where conditions are in place these are being adhered to.
There is a system in place to track, identify conditions and expiry date of DOLs.
Staff are observed obtaining consent from people.
Staff can describe how they ensure the principles of the MCA and how it is put into practice in their daily work.

There is evidence that people have appropriate contact details of their care and support provider including relevant out of hour contact details, e.g. contact details are documented in a service user guide.

There is evidence of a fully completed pre assessment prior to the person accessing the service, covering all areas of care and support, including risk, that demonstrates the provider can meet the person’s needs.
There is evidence of documented life history/about me information.
There are relevant care and support plans in place to deliver safe and effective care, e.g.:
There is evidence that care, and support plans are strength based, person centred and promotes independence.

There is evidence that care, and support plans include individual personalised outcomes. NB this may be as simple as maintaining a persons level of independence in relation to activities of daily living
There is evidence of appropriate risk assessments to deliver safe and effective care, and there are actions recorded to mitigate risk.
There is evidence that care and support plans are regularly reviewed and any change in needs are reflected accordingly.
There is evidence that risk assessments are regularly reviewed and any change in needs are reflected accordingly.
There is evidence that daily records are completed per shift or visit.
There is evidence that daily entries are factual, dated, timed, legible, and signed by the member of staff(s), including their job role(s).
There is evidence that daily entries provide a reflective account of care and support delivered and the persons health and wellbeing. NB Daily notes should be person centred
There is evidence that intervention charts are comprehensively completed and are signed and dated, e.g., food and fluid charts, repositioning charts, and pain charts.
There is evidence that activity and social interactions are recorded.
There is documented evidence of involvement from other health and social care professionals.
There is evidence of an accurately completed DNACPR/ ReSPECT document signed by a relevant health professional and easily accessible.
People confirmed that the care and support received is carried out in a way that meets their needs in line with their personal preferences.
There is evidence of a varied menu which promotes healthy eating choices and acknowledges cultural and personal preferences.
There is access to sufficient supplies of fresh food and fluids over a 24 hour period.
There are nutritional support plans in place that include food allergies, likes, dislikes and any dietary restrictions including IDDSI.
Where required there is a nutritional support plan which details any other dietary advice e.g., dietician/SALT.
Where required there is a nutritional support plan which details the MUST level and any actions to be taken to mitigate the risk.
Where required there is a MUST tool for each person which is accurately completed and reviewed in line with the tool. NB to be completed at least monthly or following a change in need
There was a menu displayed that is visible and accurate.
People confirmed that person requests of food and drinks can be accommodated e.g., flavoured tea, decaffeinated coffee.
There was a positive person-centred mealtime experience.
Where there is shared involvement from another provider this is clearly documented and there are clear processes in place to share information in a timely manner.
There is a Must do Care Plan/ Hospital Passport reflective of current need.
People confirmed that they are supported to access other social care/health services.
There is a safeguarding policy in place that reflects the North Yorkshire multiagency safeguarding policy.
There is a record of DBS status for visiting professionals (e.g., chiropodist, hairdresser, entertainers).

messages: Care files can either be written in the first person (I statements) or third person. Care plans don't necessarily need to be signed by the person or rep as long as the content is detailed and person centred
NB If the service doesnt have anyone who is able to consent to any decisions, then this would not apply
•	personal care and physical well-being, including promoting healthy lifestyles including smoking and alcohol consumption.
•	social interests, hobbies, and access to the community.
NB Assessment tools should be reviewed in line with national guidance eg MUST at least monthly
